verses.verse: The one who lives alone is self-indulgent, showing contempt for all sound judgment. (Meaning of Heb uncertain)
(Prov 12.23) A fool takes no pleasure in understanding, but only in expressing personal opinion.
When wickedness comes, contempt comes also, and with dishonor comes disgrace.
(Prov 10.11; 20.5) The words of the mouth are deep waters; the fountain of wisdom is a gushing stream.
(Lev 19.15; Deut 1.17; Prov 24.23) It is not right to be partial to the guilty or to subvert the innocent in judgment.
A fool’s lips bring strife, and a fool’s mouth invites a flogging.
(Prov 10.14; Eccl 10.12) The mouths of fools are their ruin, and their lips a snare to themselves.
(Prov 26.22) The words of a whisperer are like delicious morsels; they go down into the inner parts of the body.
(Prov 28.24) One who is slack in work is close kin to a vandal.
(2 Sam 22.3; Ps 18.2) The name of the LORD is a strong tower; the righteous run into it and are safe.
(Prov 10.15) The wealth of the rich is their strong city; in their imagination it is like a high wall.
(Prov 11.2) Before destruction one’s heart is haughty, but humility goes before honor.
(Jn 7.51) If one gives answer before hearing, it is folly and shame.
The human spirit will endure sickness, but a broken spirit—who can bear?
An intelligent mind acquires knowledge, and the ear of the wise seeks knowledge.
(Gen 32.20; 1 Sam 25.27) A gift opens doors; it gives access to the great.
The one who first states a case seems right, until the other comes and cross-examines.
(Prov 16.33) Casting the lot puts an end to disputes and decides between powerful contenders.
An ally offended is stronger than a city; (Gk Syr Vg Tg: Meaning of Heb uncertain) such quarreling is like the bars of a castle.
(Prov 12.14) From the fruit of the mouth one’s stomach is satisfied; the yield of the lips brings satisfaction.
(Mt 12.37) Death and life are in the power of the tongue, and those who love it will eat its fruits.
(Prov 19.14) He who finds a wife finds a good thing and obtains favor from the LORD.
(Jas 2.3) The poor use entreaties, but the rich answer roughly.
(Prov 17.17) Some (Syr Tg: Heb A man of) friends play at friendship, (Cn Compare Syr Vg Tg: Meaning of Heb uncertain) but a true friend sticks closer than one’s sibling.
